entry.title: Turn off KeyboardFocusableScrollers for now while we fix issues.
entry.content:
This feature changes Element::SupportsFocus to depend on layout, and

also to force layout synchronously. Both are problems that need to be

fixed, because they cause lifecycle issues when called from within the

lifecycle or post-lifecycle steps.

entry.title: Change text elider test to use a more common domain name
entry.content:
This test checks whether a spoofy looking domain is properly elided.

The spoof checks rely on a domain list and an update to the list breaks

the test because aaa.com is no longer in the list. This CL changes

the domain with a more popular one.



A better fix would be to use LookalikeTestHelper and pick a domain

from test domains list, but I'm punting that for now as this is the only

test failure in this suite.



Bug: 1151081

entry.title: aria-details should set DescribedBy UIA property
entry.content:
According to https://github.com/w3c/core-aam/pull/205, aria-details

should map to the DescribedBy UIA property. Currently, only

aria-describedby maps to that property. This change maps aria-details to

DescribedBy and removes the mapping of aria-describedby to DescribedBy.

entry.title: [Hub] Re-add startHiding tabId logic
entry.content:
This logic was originally planned for [1] but was removed after it

caused some confusion.



However, on further investigation, onTabSelecting is used as an observer

to sometimes defer tab selection until after a layout transition has

finished [2] or ensure a layout switch is triggered [3]. In the

case of Hub I don't believe this behavior is relevant. However, we

should match the behavior in TabSwitcherLayout until this logic can

possibly be refactored away and we can confirm [3] is not used.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4956814



[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/compositor/layouts/Layout.java;drc=8efd8d02fc55e5feafb62178799609ef1371ee90;l=446



[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/features/tab_ui/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/tasks/tab_management/TabSwitcherLayout.java;drc=99470270374b498a08587d265148e08aa7ac7539;l=200



Bug: 1487209, 1495121

entry.title: [window-splitting] Add UMA metrics for Window Splitting feature.
entry.content:
This change adds 6 new UMA histograms:

* Enum of whether a drag results in window splitting.

* Enum of which region window splitting happens.

* Duration of dragging when a window is split vs not.

* Number of times preview is shown when a window is split or not.



Tests are also added to assert the histograms.



Minor refactor:

* Renamed SplitPosition to SplitRegion for semantic precision.



Bug: b:293614784

entry.content:
This change adds a feature flag that, when enabled, means the above

syscalls will be blocked by the AndroidBaselinePolicy. These syscalls

are only needed by the renderer, and Android will use the

RendererProcessPolicy to allow these calls.

entry.title: Revert "Remove handling of esoteric run loop modes"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 8a171b26609f119f63b5d68f88c0678a08f208a9.



Reason for revert: broke UserNotesInteractiveTest.TriggerNotesSidePanelFromTabContextMenu



Original change's description:

> Remove handling of esoteric run loop modes

>

> https://crrev.com/c/647836 was committed to improve Chromium's

> performance while native menus were fading out.

>

> Re "NSUnhighlightMenuRunLoopMode", code inspection seems to indicate

> that its use is restricted to apps linked against 10.10 SDKs and

> earlier, which matches experimentation.

>

> Re "com.apple.hitoolbox.windows.windowfadingmode", this is not present

> on macOS 14 or later, and even in previous releases of macOS it does

> not spin for long.

>

> And finally, most animations happen in the GPU process anyway (try

> stopping the browser process in a debugger and watch the animations

> continue; it's wild!), so it's not worth the price of keeping this

> complicated code.

>

> This effectively reverts https://crrev.com/c/647836 and

> https://crrev.com/c/1006238, re-implementing the latter using AppKit

> API rather than fiddling with run loop modes, which turns out to give

> a better UI experience.

>

> Fixed: 1451674

> Change-Id: Ic1429d644d40a5373a36fb67898a3c8733c07765

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4961174

> Commit-Queue: Avi Drissman

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1213515}



Change-Id: I0694abf9ae288c25e9b309ffd4290522bfc01cd9

entry.title: [Hub] Hide tab when done showing
entry.content:
Hide the current tab when the Hub is done showing. This differs a bit

from the implementation in TabSwitcherLayout in that we don't do this

after the thumbnail capture is done, but rather after showing is

finished. The reason for this difference is



1) It is easier to reason about whether the tab is hidden as it matches

the state of the HubLayout#doneShowing().

2) For Tablets the translate animations mean the tab might be visible

during the animation. Hiding it can cause issues and unifying the

timing/codepath for phones is more maintainable than having distinct

hide timings.

3) Hiding in response to the thumbnail capture finishing required

complex cancelable callbacks and signals of when to cancel whereas

this approach is equally correct, but much simpler.



If at doneShowing() a thumbnail hasn't reached the point where hiding

will stop the capture something has likely gone wrong.



HubLayout doesn't hide the tab if the animation was interrupted because

a different layout is going to show. This can result in the Tab's

WebContents believing it is hidden when it is not leading to a bad

tab state. By not hiding in forceAnimationToFinish case we guarantee

that a rapid layout change will not result in this issue.



Bug: 1487209

Change-Id: I1b26cd5dedc3853b576551c6ef3c642545ca3cab

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4957074

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

entry.title: gl: add GLContext::GLContextObserver.
entry.content:
This is required for the per context gl texture cache.



That is, to optimize destruction/construction of GLTextures,

the OzoneImageBacking is going to utilize a per context cache.

To do that correctly, it has to listen to context lost/destruction

so that it is able to clear GLTextures.



https://crrev.com/c/4965602 is the reference



PS: it was decided to split the big CL into smaller changes.

entry.title: infra: Give chrome-build-access-sphinx swarming trigger ACLs to try & ci
entry.content:
mdb/chrome-build-access-sphinx is nice because:

- It's joined via sphinx: http://shortn/_lFffQXrHzj

- It enforces expirations.

- It should have very limited permanent membership.

- Joining is auto-approved for anyone on Chrome.

- It has no sub-groups.



This group already controls SSH access to pretty much any public

machine (see go/chrome-infra-build-access). And those are the very

machines that run anything in Chromium's try and CI pools anyway. So

giving that group trigger access to these pools doesn't give it any

more access than it already had.



Plus, many times someone wants SSH access, it's so they can debug tasks,

ie: use swarming's DEBUG button. To use that workflow they need both

swarming trigger access as well as SSH access. So there's nice synergy

to be able to satisfy both of those things by simply joining

chrome-build-access-sphinx.



Note that this differs from mdb/chrome-build-access since that group

doesn't have expirations enforced, and has chrome-troopers as a

sub-group, which is old and permanent and big, too big.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ib5099c04d301eb0e22840c9a3acb0c6d67363a67

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4958802

Reviewed-by: Erik Staab

entry.title: Ignore filters in intersection observer v1
entry.content:
According to the spec, filters don't contribute to intersection

observations.



LayoutObject::MapToVisualRectInAncestorSpace() and

GeometryMapper::LocalToAncestorVisualRect() won't expand visual rects

for filters if kIgnoreFilters is specified, and IntersectionGeometry

pass the flag (behind runtime feature

IntersectionObserverIgnoreFilters).



There is a small behavior change in the slow path of

LayoutObject::MapToVisualRectInAncestorSpace(): now filter on the

ancestor itself is not applied. This keeps consistency of the slow

path and the fast path, and conforms to the contract of the function

to map to the contents space of the ancestor. This doesn't affect any existing clients because they either map to the viewport or use the

fast path.



Bug: 1494181

Change-Id: I71991c91dd997e6e70e82781567d72d7a907d321

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4960480

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1213668}

entry.title: [Fontations-backend] Enable building Fontations when Rust is enabled
entry.content:
Enabling the Fontations backend is still guarded by a feature

flag. Enabling building by default helps with testing by the Google

Fonts team which develops the Fontations set of libraries.



This change introduces a temporary binary size increase, during which we

need both Fontation and FreeType in the binary. When we complete the

transition to Fontations we plan to remove FreeType and free up its used

binary size footprint. See internal design doc or BlinkOn 18 talk on the

Rust font stack for Chrome.



Bug: 1446251, 1471542

Binary-Size: See commit message.

Fuchsia-Binary-Size: See commit message.

entry.content:
This is an adaptation of the semaphore found at

"v8/src/base/platform/semaphore".



It currently provides four different implementations. One for each of

the desktop platforms, and one 'default' one implemented using a

locked integer and a condition variable. iOS uses the MacOS one, and

Android uses the Linux one, while Fuchsia and NaCl use the default one.

entry.title: Remove media::VideoFrameMetadata::crop_version
entry.content:
This field was supposed to be removed in CL #4905819.

However, another CL landed in the intervening time

and produced a merge conflict (#4956081). Fixing it

correctly would have required touching a new file,

requiring a new LGTM from nearly 15 people.

By the time everyone re-LGTM-ed, more conflicts

might have emerged. As such, it seemed better

to temporarily allow both sub_capture_target_version

as well as crop_version, and to fix this as a fast

follow-up that would not need to touch nearly

as many files.

Per the spec discussion:



https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/5465#discussion_r1360590511



this changes the expectation for the tests to be:



document.createElement("template").shadowRootMode === ""



rather than === null.



Note that this CL does not change Chromium's behavior, and as such

I cannot check if there are other tests that implicitly also

do a similar check. More tests might need to change once I (or

someone) implements this new behavior in a browser.

entry.title: [Extensions] Use new script serialization in userScripts API
entry.content:
Use the new scripts_internal::SerializedUserScript and script

serialization methods when registering user scripts in the

userScripts API. The flow now entails:

- Converting a api::user_scripts::RegisteredUserScript object to a

api::scripts_internal::SerializedUserScript object, then

- Using our existing methods to convert the SerializedUserScript into

an extensions::UserScript.



This results in much simpler code and will make the addition of future

items, such as support for the `code` property, much simpler.



This CL should have no effective behavior change.



Bug: 1494155

entry.title: [iOS] Fix constraint issue after hiding Feed Top Section View Controller
entry.content:
Fixed a constraint issue after the `hideSigninPromo` method is called to

hide the `FeedTopSectionViewController`. When the Sign In Promo was closed, the `FeedTopSectionViewController` did not reset its height back to zero and become fully "hidden". As a result, there was some extra padding in between the Feed Header and the Feed.



This CL updates the `FeedTopSectionViewController` to hide the entire view when the promo is hidden as well as deactivating the constraints (and the padding).

entry.title: Fix WPT css/css-masking/mask-svg-content/mask-with-filter.svg
entry.content:
The filter's region is relative to the object bounding box of the

in the mask. The object bounding box of that is <49,49 2x2>. Thus

the results of the filter will be clipped to <48.8,48.8 2.4x2.4> since

the default filter region is the object bounding box expanded by 10%.



Since the test wants the stroked shape to be filtered in its entirety,

switch the filter units to "userSpaceOnUse" to avoid the clipping.



Add a new test that tests that the clipping from the filter region is

applied.



Fixed: 1475379

entry.title: Don't call the polling state callback unnecessarily.
entry.content:
The interaction test primitive PollingStateObserver has a function

SetStateObserverStateChangedCallback(). Previously, this was called more

than once when waiting on a polling event: once from the

StateObserverElement constructor to initialize the current value, and

once when the callback was installed to tell it about the current value.



This change removes the redundant call from

SetStateObserverStateChangedCallback(). Now the StateObserverElementT is

the only place that queries the initial state and it uses the cached

value for the initial call to the observer. This was the only place

SetStateObserverStateChangedCallback was ever called so it will not

break assumptions in other code.



Bug: 1494489

Change-Id: Ifdedf832ba307530257b0ffa74405b0389532274

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4960972

entry.title: Revert "[UNO] Use bookmark uuid instead of id in ShoppingService"
entry.content:
This reverts commit c6f5b93442fef86702e7a90aab836e0bb43bff90.



Reason for revert: see https://crbug.com/1494402.



Original change's description:

> [UNO] Use bookmark uuid instead of id in ShoppingService

>

> Depending on the bookmark account storage opt-in status,

> ShoppingService has to use either LocalOrSyncable storage or Account

> storage. To make sure that wrong bookmarks aren't used by

> asynchronous methods in ShoppingService, this CL replaces usages of

> bookmark ids with uuids. This usage is internal to ShoppingService

> (ids aren't shared with any other service), so there should be no

> behavior change.

>

> Bug: 1425818

entry.title: Extensions: SidePanel: Clarify that only one is required, not both
entry.content:
This is written using a disjunction rather than a conjunction for

clarity. It seems easier to understand this way. I also asked the group

the following question, as the tags are misleadings, at best:



How much work would be required to include this comment [1] between the

title [2] and properties, and in general? It would be helpful in cases

where both properties have an `optional` tag, but the truth is that one

of them is actually `required`.



[1]

http://crsrc.org/chrome/common/extensions/api/side_panel.idl;l=49-50;drc=56ded50a8b57336df65453dfa337b803cd5b8faf

[2]

https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/sidePanel/#type-OpenOptions

entry.title: Migrate network errors UI to JS modules.
entry.content:
Network errors UIs are not proper WebUI pages and therefore they

can't load any dependencies at runtime, as there is no backing

WebUIDataSource to serve them.



For this reason, these UIs resort to bundling all the code to a single

JS and HTML file pair at buildtime. Currently this is achieved by using

Grit which is problematic because:

- It relies on Grit's obsolete flattenhtml=true mechanism

- It doesn't work with JS modules (Grit simply concatenates files)



Addressed here by leveraging the bundle_js() GN rule which is the

canonical way in the codebase for generating JS bundles from

modularized JS code.



This removes one of the last few non-JS module code in the codebase, and

paves the way for further migrating such files to TypeScript.



Bug: 1347008

Change-Id: I0a9738685e4f0f042a17a8914107422e7ed749b8

entry.title: [Exo]Animation fix w.r.t RecreateLayers
entry.content:
When an animation causes the `host_window` to `RecreateLayers`, the

animation treats the new `host_window->layer` as if it's ready to be

shown. Before the client has time to ack to the config event for that

request, the `old_layer` prior to the cloning should be hosting the

incoming wl_surface commits, i.e. it's the `commit_target_layer`.



If incoming commits cause the surface hierarchy to change bounds, it

should be changing bounds of the `commit_target_layer`, instead of the

`host_window->layer`.



This CL ensures that the bounds changes from the client goes to its

`commit_target_layer`, and updates the `viz::SurfaceId` range for the

`host_window->layer` s.t. fallback looks correct via stretching.



Changes:

1) `Config`: stores an extra field `old_layer` to track the Layer

prior to cloning.

2) `AllocateLocalSurfaceId`: `host_window`'s parent seq_number

increments will be suppressed if they're originated from the client

modifying the wayland surface hierarchy.

3) `GetCommitTargetLayer()`: returns the ui::Layer that can host

client's surface commits. Due to animation cancelling destroying the

old_layer with it, this may return nullptr.

4) `MaybeActivateSurface()`: for ShellSurface that has a config queue,

it updates the surface range of `old_layer`s, and `host_window`'s

layer, to be:

[current_surface_id, max(layer_surface_id, current_surface_id)].

And rely on stretching fallback surface when the deadline expires.



Bug: 1251778, 1468344

Change-Id: I4c7c95aead4a04037826abf94dac1fa247972f9b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4739372

Reviewed-by: Eliot Courtney

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

Commit-Queue: Kramer Ge

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1213576}

entry.title: Printing: Trigger updates to printer status icons
entry.content:
- This CL parses the printer status from 'local-printers-updated'

printer updates then attempts to update the UI

- Destination Store receives the status, updates the relevant

destination, then sends out the event.

- Destination Settings listens to the event and triggers the selected

destination and dropdown to update.

- Destination Dialog listens to the event and triggers the dialog

destinations to update.



Bug: b:300136694

Tests: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*DestinationStoreTest*, --gtest_filter=*DestinationSettingsTest*

entry.content:
The WoA EngProd team and Chrome Browser Infra team are working together

to provide signals to builder owners when their builders are slow,

failing often, or otherwise unhealthy or low-value.



This change will add team email addresses to gardened builders so that

owner teams are notified when there are problems with their builders.

entry.title: webauthn: allow auto-selection of WebAuthn credentials.
entry.content:
Android CredMan will skip the account selector if both parties to a

transaction set a flag to allow it, and there's only a single possible

credential.



WebAuthn requests with an allowlist match typically skip the account

selector, but Chrome wasn't setting the flag to allow this with CredMan.



(This change is flag guarded implicitly because the overall CredMan

support is not yet launched.)



Low-Coverage-Reason: n/a

entry.title: [Mac] Use ad-hoc code signatures for PWA app shims
entry.content:
The app shims used for progressive web apps on macOS are currently

constructed by building an app bundle and copying an executable out of

the browser's app bundle. This means that the app shim's code signature

is not valid and that every app shim has the same identity from the

operating system's point of view (same signature means same designated

requirement, thus same identity). This leads to a few issues described

in crbug.com/1465647.



If we instead ad-hoc code sign the app shim after creating it, each app

shim ends up with a valid code signature and separate identity.



In order for the browser process to perform the same validation of

connecting app shims that it does at present, information about the

signature of each app shim is stored in `AppShimRegistry`. This

information is checked to ensure that only app shims that the browser

signed are permitted to connect.



For now this is behind the disabled UseAdHocSigningForWebAppShims

feature flag.



Bug: 1465647

Change-Id: Ibfc888d48de57637056636caadadfaa666176b95

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4854530

Reviewed-by: Robert Sesek

Reviewed-by: Marijn Kruisselbrink

Reviewed-by: Chase Phillips

entry.title: [FLEDGE] Don't treat lone negative score as error in component auctions.
entry.content:
When seller scripts want to reject an ad, they can return a negative

score (or 0). Before this CL, in a component auction, it was treated as

an error if they didn't return those scores in an object that had an

`allowComponentAuction` value of true. This CL makes setting

`allowComponentAuction` unnecessary - seller scripts can now just

return a score <= 0 directly to reject a bid without printing an error.



Note that this has no effect on the winner of an auction, as both

errors and scores <= 0 meant the bid being scored couldn't win. All it

does is avoid printing an error, and result in not throwing away debug

report URLs when component seller worklets return scores <= 0 without

setting `allowComponentAuction` to true.



Bug: None

Change-Id: Ie55762b7404b99407f79a5281c6a1c75a9b77449

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4956815

Reviewed-by: Caleb Raitto

entry.title: Remove incorrect Classify() parameter from AutocompleteController.
entry.content:
This parameter must have either changed its meaning, or was not

correct from the start. The `focused from fakebox` parameter was used

to trigger asynchronous classification cycle, which yields

asynchronous matches (something that is not desired, given that

Classify is expected to return synchronous AutocompleteMatch).



What further reinforces the incorrect use of this parameter is a

DCHECK() confirming that all AutocompleteProviders are `done()` -

which cannot possibly be true if we permit them to run asynchronously.



One may also spot the call in question surrounded with

`inside_synchronous_start_`, hinting that the original intent was to

run that block synchronously AND suppress any AutocompleteResults from

being propagated up to the client, which also supports the assertion

that permitting asynchronous classification is incorrect.



Bug: 1490333

Change-Id: I4c9f6bc25c38323fbd28737a6f738d81af48398e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4958804

entry.title: Fix device policy pre-upload hooks
entry.content:
Instead of searching for a device policy with an external data type,

search for a policy that is either a device policy or a policy with an

external data type. This bug earlier caused a revert of

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4868219.



I also thought about running these hooks if there are changes in other

policy-related files, but the current hooks are probably good enough

(they cover the scenario of adding a new policy, for instance).
